summary:
• First Gold Poured: Processing plant commissioning completed, with first gold poured on 1 July 2025 (on schedule).
  • Capital Expenditure: Actual pre-production CAPEX of $68.6m (vs. DFS estimate of $45.7m), driven by accelerated mining activities and infrastructure expansion.
  • Cash Position: $56m cash at quarter-end, no debt (excluding equipment finance).
  • Production Ramp-Up:
  • Open-pit mining expanded (three pits operational).
  • Underground mine development to commence in September 2025.
  • Exploration Results: High-grade intercepts at Turnberry (e.g., 10m @ 5.20g/t Au), potential to extend open-pit resources.
  • Safety/Environmental: Zero lost-time injuries; no significant environmental incidents.

No material capital markets events (e.g., raising, trading halt) identified.

• Substantial Holder Update: Kinterra Capital GP Corp. II increased its stake in New World Resources Limited (NWC) from 63.03% to 64.59% (total holdings: 2,309,587,419 shares).
  • Change Details:
  • Acquisition via Takeover Offer: 25,400,879 shares at A$0.067/share (off-market).
  • On-Market Purchase: 30,428,271 shares at A$0.067/share.
  • Offer Context: Part of Kinterra’s off-market takeover bid (bidder’s statement dated 26 June 2025).

Note: No material trading or capital-raising actions by NWC; update reflects incremental stake increase by a major holder.

Encounter Resources Limited – Quarterly Report (30 June 2025) – Material Information Summary

Aileron Niobium-REE-Copper Project (100% ENR)

  • Initial Resource: 19.2Mt @ 1.74% Nb₂O₅ (shallow, high-grade, open at depth/strike).
  • Joyce Discovery: 9m @ 2.2% Nb₂O₅, ~6km from Green Deposit.
  • Processing: Conventional methods could yield high-grade concentrate (88% pyrochlore liberation).
  • Exploration: Ongoing RC/aircore drilling across 15+ targets; airborne EM survey (3,675km²) underway.
  • Funding: $250k WA govt grant for EM targeting.
  • Team Expansion: Key hires in metallurgy, corporate development, and marketing.

Yeneena Copper Project (100% ENR)

  • 100% ownership regained after IGO exit ($15M prior investment).
  • BM5 Target: Gossanous chips (15m @ 21.8g/t Ag, 1,729ppm Cu); RC drilling planned October 2025.
  • BM1 Target: High-grade oxide copper (e.g., 20m @ 2.0% Cu); reassessing for sulphide potential.

Jessica Copper Project (South32 Farm-in)

  • Upcoming Work: MIMDAS surveys (in progress), 2,640km airborne EM (Aug–Sep 2025), drill testing from October 2025.

Financials

  • Cash (30/6/2025): $18.6M.
  • Market Cap (29/7/2025): ~$130M.
  • Qtrly Expenditure: $2.2M on exploration (primarily Aileron, copper targets).
  • Funding Runway: ~8.9 quarters (based on current cash and outgoings).

Key Upcoming Catalysts

  • Aileron: Infill drilling (Green), Joyce RC drilling, metallurgical results.
  • Yeneena: BM5 RC drilling (October 2025).
  • Jessica: Drill testing post-geophysical surveys (Q4 2025).

Omitted: Routine operational updates, tenement lists, non-material corporate details.

Here’s the material information extracted from the Quarterly Activities Report (June 2025) for trading/capital markets purposes:

Operational Highlights

  • Record production: 58,533 dmt spodumene (↑35% QoQ) at 5.2% Li₂O grade.
  • Sales volume: 66,980 dmt sold (↑148% QoQ), aligning with H2FY25 forward-sales strategy.
  • Pricing: Avg. realized price $1,054/dmt (↓8% QoQ), outperforming spot market declines (↓15–20% QoQ).
  • Costs: Unit operating cost ↓10% QoQ to $1,232/dmt (US$791/dmt).

Financial Highlights

  • Revenue: $71M (↑129% QoQ) on higher volumes, partially offset by lower prices.
  • Cash balance: $72.3M (↓$16.6M QoQ), impacted by $12M NAL operating loss and $4M merger costs.

Corporate/M&A

  • Merger with Piedmont Lithium: Target completion 12 August 2025; EGM scheduled for 31 July 2025.
  • Post-merger entity "Elevra Lithium" to be 50/50 owned by Sayona/Piedmont shareholders.
  • Includes $69M placement to Resource Capital Fund VIII at $0.032/share (subject to merger approval).
  • Share consolidation: 150:1 ratio post-merger.

Guidance

  • FY25 targets achieved; FY26 guidance to be released with full-year results in late August 2025.

Liquidity/Structure

  • Shares outstanding: 11.54B ordinary shares + 280.5M unquoted performance rights.

Omitted: Safety/ESG updates, exploration details, non-material operational metrics.

Material Information Summary (Quarterly Report):

  • Revenue Performance:
  • $912k revenue in Q2 FY25 (+19% YoY, second-best quarter on record).

  • RentPay revenue up 68% YoY; now 30% of total Group revenue.

  • Capital & Liquidity:

  • Cash balance: $615k at quarter end.
  • Debt facility: $10m senior secured credit facility secured (15% interest, maturity Jan 2027). Not yet drawn.

  • Capital raising: Completed $2.67m fully underwritten Entitlement Issue post-quarter.

  • Key Operational Milestones:

  • RentBond: Transition to self-funded lending imminent; expected 6x revenue uplift per loan.

  • RentPay: Active users up 58% YoY (800 new customers); higher ARPU from non-traditional payments.

  • Outlook: Improving cash flow outlook post-capital raise and debt facility utilization.

No further material disclosures identified.

• Director Share Sales:
  • Stefano Marani (Executive Director) sold 334,327 shares at R15.80 per share (total R5,282,366.60), retaining 5.62% stake.
  • Nicholas Mitchell (Executive Director) sold 76,695 shares at R15.80 per share (total R1,211,781.00), retaining 5.54% stake.
  • Transaction Date: 28 July 2025 (on-market sales).

No other material information identified.

Here’s the material information extracted from the ASX announcement, strictly tailored for trading and capital markets decisions:

Exploration Update Summary

  • Key Findings:
  • Identified four gold anomalies (Au1–Au4) and three base metal anomalies (BM1–BM3) from geochemical analysis of 2,813 soil samples.
  • Au1 anomaly: Most significant, with rock chips up to 11.95 g/t Au, supported by quartz veining and historic workings.
  • Pyr1 anomaly: Hydrothermal alteration zone with pathfinder elements (e.g., Ag 9x, Cd 8x above background).

  • Reprocessed aeromagnetic data highlights regional structures (Keith-Kilkenny and Melita-Emu Faults), potential fluid pathways.

  • Historic Drilling:

  • Limited testing: Shallow RAB drilling (avg. 48m depth) over anomalies; no drilling since 2003.

  • Best intercept: 4m @ 2.5 g/t Au (RAB hole NNW3).

  • Next Steps:

  • Infill soil sampling to refine targets.
  • Planned IP surveys to guide future drill campaigns.

Valuation Impact:

  • Upside Potential: Untested anomalies in a region with major deposits (e.g., Gwalia, Teutonic Bore).
  • Caution: No JORC resources yet; early-stage exploration.

No capital raising, financials, or material corporate updates identified.

Action: Monitor follow-up results for drill target prioritization.

Material Information Summary (Quarterly Activities Report – ASX: LEX)

Key Highlights:

  • Profit-Sharing Mining Agreement (BML Ventures):
  • Targets Lucky Strike Gold Deposit (1.27Mt @ 1.95 g/t Au, 79,600 oz MRE).
  • 50/50 profit split; BML funds all mining capex/opex (LEX avoids dilution).
  • Toll milling secured with Greenfields Mill (Coolgardie) for 80,000–90,000 tonnes (Feb 2026 slot).

  • Mining operations expected H1 FY2026.

  • Funding:

  • $2.5M Profit Cash Advance Facility from BML ($1M upfront + $500k/quarter, 8% coupon).

  • Cash reserves: $1.69M (30 June 2025); no debt.

  • Drilling Results (Lucky Strike):

  • High-grade near-surface intercepts (e.g., 19m @ 4.10 g/t Au, 7m @ 8.46 g/t Au).

  • Program validated resource model, with potential for resource expansion.

  • Upcoming Catalysts:

  • Final assay results (Sep 2025 quarter).
  • Advanced discussions for additional toll milling (target: 250,000 tonnes for Stage 1).
  • Exploration focus: Mt Martin and Burns Gold Deposit extensions.

Resource Summary (JORC-Compliant):

  • Mt Martin (Gold): 9.29Mt @ 1.47 g/t Au (439,000 oz).
  • Burns (Au-Cu): 42.96Mt @ 0.36 g/t Au + 0.16% Cu (497,472 oz Au, 58,300t Cu).

Omitted: Routine corporate updates, tenement schedules, and forward-looking disclaimers.

Material Information Summary

  • New Assay Results (Patterson Corridor East):
  • RK-25-227: 12.0 m at 3.46% U₃O₈, including 2.5 m at 14.9% U₃O₈ and 0.5 m at 31.0% U₃O₈.
  • RK-25-232 (previously reported): 15.0 m at 15.9% U₃O₈, including 3.0 m at 47.8% U₃O₈ and 0.5 m at 68.8% U₃O₈.

  • RK-24-222 (previously reported): 17.0 m at 3.85% U₃O₈.

  • Exploration Highlights:

  • Continuity confirmed: High-grade mineralization persists between drill holes (RK-25-227 located 100 m from RK-25-232 and RK-24-222).

  • 2024 assays fully received; 2025 winter drilling ongoing, with majority of campaign still ahead.

  • Strategic Commentary:

  • Management compares PCE to Arrow deposit, emphasizing high-grade potential and open growth in all directions.
  • Emphasis on rising uranium demand linked to nuclear energy adoption.

No capital markets actions (e.g., financing, trading halt) or financial data disclosed. Focus remains on resource expansion.

Conclusion: Material for investors assessing resource growth and project valuation, but no immediate trading/capital actions indicated.

Quarterly Activities Report Summary (30 June 2025)

Key Operational Highlights:
- Drilling commenced at Schleidberg well site (5th well in Phase One Lionheart Project).
- 35-year heat offtake agreement signed with EnergieSüdwest AG for renewable heat supply in Landau, Germany.
- €1bn German Raw Materials Fund (RMF) due diligence completed; government participation secured for Project financing.
- €104m (~A$187m) German government grants approved post-quarter for strategic lithium production (TCTF scheme).
- €30m (~A$53.6m) strategic placement completed, led by BNP Paribas’ Clean Energy Solutions Fund.
- Maiden geothermal Resource estimate for Mannheim licence: 2,848 PJ (Indicated) and 10,539 PJ (Inferred).

Financials:
- Development expenditure: €8.1m (primarily for drilling, plant prep).
- Cash flow: Gross revenue of €0.85m from Insheim geothermal plant (3,280MWh sold at €0.260/kWh).

Project Milestones:
- Building permits secured for 30MW geothermal plant and substation in Landau.
- Debt commitment letter extended to September 2025; final financing targeted for H2 2025.
- Advanced negotiations with a premium German automaker for 8-year lithium hydroxide offtake (LOI signed).

Resource Update:
- Lithium Resource increased 76% in Mannheim licence (now 3,225kt LCE @ 155 mg/Li).

Subsequent Events:
- Geox acquisition completed (includes geothermal wells and Landau licence).

ESG:
- Won AFR Sustainability Leader 2025 (Resources, Energy & Utilities).
- 1 Lost Time Injury reported during the quarter.

No material changes to Mineral Reserves.

Prioritized for trading impact: financing progress, resource updates, operational milestones.

Here’s the extracted material information from the ASX announcement, formatted as concise bullet points:

Exploration Results Announcement (Little Gem Prospect)

  • High-grade drill results:
  • Hole LGDD25008: 8.8m @ 6.3g/t Au at 320m depth, extending Diamond Lode strike to >1,000m (open at depth).
  • Hole LGDD25005 (previously reported): 22.7m @ 5.0g/t Au.
  • Multi-lode system confirmed: Four named lodes (Diamond, Ruby, Sapphire, Tanzanite), with Diamond/Ruby as priority targets.
  • Phase 3 drilling commenced:
  • 38-hole program, targeting depths of 500m–750m.
  • Two diamond rigs + one RC rig active.
  • FY26 exploration budget: $73M allocated for resource development drilling.

Key Implications

  • Resource expansion potential: High-grade intercepts suggest scalable mineralised system.
  • Operational momentum: Ongoing drilling aims to rapidly define lode geometry and scale.

No material capital markets activity (e.g., raising, halt) identified.

(Note: Omitted boilerplate, JORC details, and non-material operational updates.)

No other material information identified.

Quarterly Report (Appendix 4C) Summary:
- Key Operational Highlights:
- Updated JORC Mineral Resource Estimate (MRE): 842kt @ 4.3g/t Au (117koz), including a high-grade zone of 60kt @ 28.3g/t Au (55koz).
- 38% increase in total ounces vs. maiden MRE (June 2024); 66% in Indicated category.
- New shallow, open-pittable Tiptoe Lode added to MRE.
- Scoping Study update underway (expected August 2025) incorporating revised MRE and gold price.

  • Exploration:
  • Deepest intercept to date: 4.1m @ 2.75g/t Au (incl. 0.75m @ 11.35g/t) at 443m depth.

  • Mineralization remains open at depth/strike; multiple untested targets (e.g., Valiant, McTavish North).

  • Financials (Quarter Ending 30 June 2025):

  • Closing cash balance: AUD 777k (down from AUD 1.63m previous quarter).
  • Exploration spend: AUD 686k; 0.9 quarters of funding remaining (per Appendix 5B).
  • Planned capital raise in H2 2025 to fund operations (not yet finalized).

Material Impact Items:
1. Resource upgrade enhances project economics (high-grade, shallow ounces).
2. Limited liquidity (cash runway <1 quarter) implies near-term dilution risk.

Omitted: Routine drilling results, director fees, tenement lists.

Synlait Milk Limited – Performance Update (30 July 2025)

  • FY25 Forecasts:
  • Underlying EBITDA: $100–110m (vs. $45.2m in FY24).
  • Underlying NPAT: Breakeven (vs. -$60.4m in FY24).
  • Reported NPAT loss: -$27m to -$40m (vs. -$182.1m in FY24).

  • Reported EBITDA: $50–68m (vs. -$4.1m in FY24).

  • Key Issues:

  • Manufacturing challenges at Dunsandel facility led to one-off costs (now resolved).
  • Targeting net debt of $300m at FY25 close.

  • Banking covenants remain compliant.

  • Next Update: Full FY25 results announced 29 September 2025.

Omitted: CEO commentary, operational details without material impact.
